name: hittable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
able to be hit or easy to hit: No one ever expects him to deliver a hittable ball. He became a different fighter - heavier, not as quick, and more hittable.
sports
  specialized If a pitcher or bowler (= a player who throws the ball in a sports game) is hittable, it is possible to hit a ball that they throw: At times, Beckett was more hittable than he had been in his recent starts.
More examplesFewer examplesAfter reaching 69, the outfielder saw few hittable pitches.The pitcher has quick hands for a big guy, but he is just too hittable.As the novelty of his unusual delivery and variety of pitches wore off, he became more hittable.
